data.title: Atom fails to start, "A JavaScript error occured in the browser process"
data.body:
I'm currently using commit f026d30426

I'm running Gentoo, I built atom from source. It worked on a commit from a few days ago. I will try and bisect it. `atom -f` produces the following output:

```
[12518:1216/005553:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(163)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
A JavaScript error occured in the browser process
Uncaught Exception:
Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 17, got 16.
    at Error (native)
    at Object.module.(anonymous function) [as .node] (/usr/share/atom/resources/atom/common/lib/asar.js:422:20)
    at Module.load (module.js:363:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:318:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
    at require (module.js:392:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/nslog/lib/nslog.js:5:11)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app/node_modules/nslog/lib/nslog.js:15:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:468:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:486:10)
ATTENTION: default value of option force_s3tc_enable overridden by environment.
```

Atom fails to start in any meaningful way since it seems to fail to import `nslog`.

data.title: Atom on Windows (Installer) 0.158.0 - Running from command line leaves open process
data.body:
Hi,

Since moving over from the Chocolatey package to the windows based installer for atom, when I use "atom ." from a console with Atom not already open it displays some debug information and then opens but it leaves the console window locked to that process showing debug information

> C:\code\mydirectory [dev]> atom .
> App load time: 127ms
> [8372:1216/145708:INFO:renderer_main.cc(204)] Renderer process started
> [10808:1216/145712:INFO:CONSOLE(64)] "Window load time: 3059ms", source: file:///C:/Users/<username>/AppData/Local/atom/app-0.158.0/resources/app/static/index.js (64)

If atom is already open, then it opens and switches to that folder as the project and the console window shows:

> C:\code\mydirectory [dev +0 ~1 -0]> atom .
> [11772:1216/145426:ERROR:crash_reporter_win.cc(70)] Cannot initialize out-of-process crash handler
> App load time: 114ms

This way actually terminates in the console window fine, returning control of that console back to me.

Thanks

James

data.title: Better grammar auto-detection?
data.body:
There's a pretty obscure coding language out there called Sourcepawn, and I've recently released a [language package](https://atom.io/packages/language-sourcepawn) for it.  The only problem now is that both Sourcepawn and PHP use the `.inc` file type.  I didn't include a `firstLineMatch` for the Sourcepawn package because there's really no telling what someone will decide to put for the first line (they could immediately start with the code, or maybe a comment, or maybe a preprocessor...).  Since neither PHP nor Sourcepawn can definitively claim the file as its own, it seems like PHP then takes precedence simply because it comes before Sourcepawn in the alphabet (I haven't tested this, but it seems pretty plausible).

So, is there any way that the auto-detection of grammar could be improved by, say, looking at the regex in each language and seeing which one lines up better?

data.title: Add atom.sh and apm.sh Windows scripts
data.body:
For use in Windows shells that are bash-like.

Closes #4586

data.title: New config API
data.body:
This PR updates the config API, but does not change the way global properties are stored. They still aren't stored in the scoped property store.

Refs #4567.
### Steps
- [x] Make `Config::get` and `::set` take trailing options hashes
- [x] Add a `source` option to `Config::set`
- [x] Use the user's settings file path as the default source in `::set`
- [x] Add `sources` and `excludeSources` options to `Config::get`
- [x] Fix remaining failing specs related to the user config using new source information
- [x] Add `Config::unset`
- [x] Make `Config::observe` and `::onDidChange` consistent with `::get` by taking a scope as an option instead of the first argument.
- [x] Throw exception when trying to specify a `source` without a scope selector (To be fixed by #4567).
- [x] Bugfix: only use special priority for settings w/ user's config file as source
- [x] Update docs
- [x]  Deprecate `::isDefault` and `::getDefault` in favor of using the `source` option to `::get`
- [ ] Add a way to get settings set from with a source _directory_ (needed by [this code](https://github.com/atom/settings-view/blob/master/lib/package-snippets-view.coffee#L26) in settings-view)

data.title: Better save notifications
data.body:
We dont handle saving errors very well. Say when someone tries to save, and it cannot write for some reason, permissions, lack of directory, trying to overwrite a directory, etc. This will kick out a warning notification rather than a fatal error.

This will fix:
- #4607 
- #4616 
- #4495

data.title: Add a hook so packages can support more version control systems
data.body:
The project API currently only supports Git. This diff makes it possible for 3rd-party packages to add support for other version control systems, addressing issue https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4138.

Here's an example of a preliminary package that adds support for Mercurial: https://github.com/oclbdk/vcs-hg

Here's a demo of it in action:

![vcs-hg demo](http://i.imgur.com/3vOhrml.gif)

data.title: Refresh packages in Atom after running apm commands
data.body:
I'm not sure which atom-package this belongs in ([settings-view](/atom/settings-view)? [apm](/atom/apm)?) but if you have Atom open, and you `apm install` a package instead of installing through the settings-view UI, then Atom will not register the new package unless you `Window: Reload` or restart Atom. This is kind of jarring and clunky as far as UX goes - Atom should really auto-refresh after you `apm install` a package, so you can immediately make use of it.

This applies to any apm command - if you `apm uninstall` a package for instance, Atom will also not know unless you take one of the steps above.

(Atom 0.158 / Mac OS X 10.10.1)

data.title: Can I use GPL code in an Atom package
data.body: I'm considering using some open-source code that is the only code that has the features I want.  It is GPL licensed.  Does anyone know a reason, other than philosophical, to avoid GPL licensed code in a package?  Would it restrict it's usage anywhere?

data.title: Use `*` instead of `global` as the global selector in user settings
data.body: Our scoped settings system is based on the idea that all settings get associated with a selector. In light of this, the `global` key is idiosyncratic. We should just use the standard global selector, `*`, which is what we actually use in the scoped properties store.
